element.short: Classification of  type of observation (Observation Category)
element.definition: A code that classifies the general type of observation being made (e.g. Frequency eating: category will be breakfast, lunch, diner, … and ObservationCode will be quantity of meet taken, quantity of cereal taken, quantity of fruit taken, …)

element.label: observationCode
element.definition: Code of the recorded observation (e.g.: in the context of the blood glucose level periode: Meal taken, physical activity, ...)

element.label: Patient
element.short: The unique identification number of an instrument that automatically takes the measurement.
element.definition: The unique identification number sof an instrument that automatically takes the measurement (e.g. a device for measuring blood sugar, a blood pressure monitor connected to a computer, etc.)

element.label: observationDate
element.short: Date of taking the parameter / observation
element.definition: Date of taking the parameter / observation; clinically relevant time / timePeriod for observation (eg: today, 10th august, a general practitioner asks to a patient his weight, the patient answers: 10 days ago, my weight was 73 kg. Thus the record date is 10/08/2020 and the ObservationDate is 08/01/2020.)

element.label: recordDate
element.short: Date of recording of the observation
Who is responsible for asserting the observed value. A device has been used for asserting the observation value.
element.definition: Who is responsible for asserting the observed value. The performer is a divice number, the patient or related person.

element.short: It is the result of the parameter
element.definition: It is the result of the parameter, it can be found in different form: numerical value in the case of the meak taken quantity etc.

element.label: conclusion
element.short: A final conclusion of the observation
element.definition: A final conclusion of the observation
Related measurements the observation is made from.
